column1: ... = data not available; | = marks break in series; – = magnitude equals zero; (-/+) 0.0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate, budget figure; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour; m3 = cubic meter; NPISHs = nonprofit institutions serving households; SDRs = special drawing rights; t = metric ton; Tk = taka.

column2: Note: A base year represented as, e.g., 2000/2001, corresponds to the fiscal year (e.g., beginning 1 July 2000 and ending 30 June 2001) and related data is presented in the column for the single year during which most of the fiscal year occurred (e.g., 2001) .
For 2000–2018, population data are based on the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics Sample Vital Registration System.
For 2000–2010, data include electricity, gas, steam, and air-conditioning supply; water supply; and sewerage, waste management, and remediation activities.
For 2000–2010, data include wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles; and accommodation and food service activities.
For 2000–2010, data include transportation and storage; and information and communication.

For 2000–2010, data include real estate, renting and business activities; education, health, and social work; and community, social, and personal services. Data from 2011 onward include community, social, and personal services.
Refers to gross fixed capital formation.
Gross fixed capital formation includes data on changes in inventories.
For 2000–2002, net current transfers are the sum of net transfers from abroad and net borrowings from abroad.
In estimating the GDP and GNI per capita, the population as of January is used.
For 2014, data are from 1 January to 28 February.
For 2014, data are from July 2013 to April 2014.
Refers to gross rent, fuel, and lighting.
Refers to food, nonalcoholic and alcoholic beverages, and tobacco.
Refers to claims on other public sector in 2008 to 2018.
Refers to total advances and investments of deposit-taking banks.
Refers to savings bank accounts with checking facilities.
Derived as revenue less expense, plus the consumption of fixed capital.
From 2009 onward, "Others" includes expenditure from other ministries.
